elements.title: Rommy Revson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that nightclub singer Rommy Revson earned millions of dollars from her 1986 invention of the scrunchie (examples pictured), which she originally named after her pet poodle?

elements.title: 2022 Hong Kong Masters (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Mark Williams travelled for more than 13 hours to be a last-minute replacement at the 2022 Hong Kong Masters?

elements.title: Sir Frank Price (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Sir Frank Price, a former Lord Mayor of Birmingham, grew up in the city's slums and left school at the age of 14?

elements.title: Holy Ground (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the beat in Taylor Swift's song "Holy Ground" was described by Brad Nelson of The Atlantic as "insistent enough to act as punctuation for the lyrics"?

elements.title: The Funeral of the Anarchist Galli (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Carlo Carrà attributed The Funeral of the Anarchist Galli to the 1904 Italian general strike, while the actual funeral and riot occured in 1906?

elements.title: Alfred Skrenda (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that American illustrator Alfred Skrenda "was particularly adept at billowing skirts and heroic gazes"?

elements.title: Pedestals of Biahmu (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Pedestals of Biahmu are known locally as Al-Ṣanam, Arabic for "the idol"?

elements.title: Clinton Keeling (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Sugar Puffs bear once escaped from Clinton Keeling's home zoo?
